text: Francis Marion Drake (December 30, 1830 â€“ November 20, 1903) was an American businessman, lawyer, banker and politician. He fought in the American Civil War. He was the 16th Governor of Iowa. He is the namesake of Drake University. == References == Category:1830 births Category:1903 deaths Category:19th- century American politicians Category:Businesspeople from Iowa Category:Lawyers from Iowa Category:Governors of Iowa Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:Businesspeople from Illinois Category:Lawyers from Illinois Category:Politicians from Illinois
title: Francis M. Drake
